free	malloc

getter	setter
the reason you might want to use a getter setter is because it conceals the implementation

3802209
getter	setter
you won t have to rewrite all of your code if you are using getter setter in case the implementation does change because those members can continue to work

3802209
getter	setter
as for a class using setter and getter on itself that may depend on the particulars

3802209
getter	setter
in the cases where a class is normally instantiated the class should use the member values directly for its own members private or otherwise and its parent classes if they are protected and only use getter setter in the case that those members are private to the parent class

3802209
getter	setter
in the case of an abstract type which will usually not contain any implementation at all it should provide pure virtual getter and setter and use only those in the methods it does implement

3802392
getter	setter
it seems most people didn t read your question properly the question is concerning whether or not class methods accessing its own class members should use getter and setter

3802392
getter	setter
i wouldn t bother using getter and setter for accessing a class own members

3802392
getter	setter
i only use getter and setter for accessing my own class members when i am expecting to change the implementation in the near future if i m writing a suboptimal code that can be written quickly but plans to optimize it in the future that might involve radically changing the data structure used

3802392
getter	setter
conversely i don t use getter and setter before i already have the plan

3802392
getter	setter
in particular i don t use getter and setter in expectation of changing things i m very likely never going to change anyway

3802392
public	protected
i use protected members conservatively and they are considered a public interface

3802392
getter	setter
however even for public interface i usually still avoid having direct getter and setter methods as they are often indicative of bad oo design every oo programmers in any language should read why getter and setter methods are evil

3802402
ant	pom.xml
i have to add a lazy true to a property i have add a ant task to intrument the class to enable hibernate to make it lazy in my pom.xml

3802414
getter	setter
getter and setter for protected members makes as much sense as for public.

3802414
getter	setter
getter and setter for private members is rarely a net benefit though

3802414
public	protected
in enterprise environments and for public protected member data those benefits can be substantial enough to justify get set methods a logging function may end up having millions of lines of code depedent on it and hundreds or thousands of libraries and apps for which a change to a header may trigger recompilation

3852063
free	malloc

3852063
free	malloc

3852063
free	malloc
